title: About Me
text:
Hello! I’m Caleb, a recent graduate from UCLA, now pursuing my Master’s in Finance at Waseda University in Tokyo, Japan.
I’m passionate about using data-driven insights to solve real-world problems, from machine learning and NLP to predictive analytics and now financial markets. I especially enjoy projects that merge storytelling with data—whether it’s analyzing trends, building recommendation systems, or applying quantitative models to investment and risk management.
Beyond academics, I enjoy learning new languages, going to concerts, and exploring cafes in new cities.

title: Caleb Williams
text: Hello! I’m Caleb, a recent graduate of UCLA where I majored in Statistics & Data Science. I’ve just started my Master’s in Finance at Waseda University, where I’m interested in blending data science with finance to build tools for analysis, prediction, and risk management.

title: Caleb Williams
text:
Projects

1. Recipe Recommendation App
Python


Used Scrapy to webscrape 10,000+ recipes, nutritional info, reviews from allrecipes.com

Cleaned and stored data with Pandas and Sqlite3

Implemented Dash web app that provided recipe recommendations based on user-input ingredients, preferences, and cook times



2. Textual Analysis of Romantic Comedies
R & Python


Analyzed 30 popular rom-coms from the last 40 years to explore predictability trends across decades

Compared textual content using word clouds, lexical diversity metrics, and N-gram pairwise correlations

Examined cross-decade sentiment shifts and applied clustering analysis & LDA topic modeling

Built a random forest model and compared its predictive performance against a DistilBERT model test edit
